intro: Thelechitonia muricata, commonly known as the rough-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has leathery, often hairy leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant produces woody, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds.
